description: From Late Latin Anacreonticus, from Ancient Greek Ἀνακρέων (Anakréōn), Anacreon a Greek poet.

adjectives.description: anacreontic (comparative more anacreontic, superlative most anacreontic)

entries.meaning: (prosody) Pertaining to the style of the Greek poet Anacreon, who wrote of wine and love; (specifically) designating a metre based on an anaclastic ionic dimeter. [from 17th c.]
Characterised by festivity and the celebration of love and/or drinking; bacchanalian, amorous. [from 17th c.]
examples: [T]he false Thecla  […]  had initiated me into the anacreontic diversions and fruitions of men and women.

entries.meaning: (poetry) A short lyrical piece about love and wine.
